+++++ ObservationsTwo/ObservationTwo.md
There has been significant research and scholarship for decades with rigorous conceptualizations and the
development of many axiomatic theories informing scientific research in the Harrelson
Paradox.  Efforts by many
scholars have tried to link a limited number of socio-political behavioral variables with one aspect
observed from public policy outcomes. For many years this has attempted to describe phenomena of the GarFink
Experience within an Islamic perspective, but it failed to explain fully dynamic conceptual frameworks
from a Western perspective. The GarFink Experience has been viewed as variably influenced by aspects.
This effort fails to conceptualize the GarFink Experience with political economy and it only brings us to the
same situation as Sayville Threat Analysis, which leaves out cultural variables.

| The GarFink Experience
| - is cased by certain issues, but not defined precisely by issues |
| - while the Harrelson Paradox *provides offer a normative guide about how to navigate the emergent issues |  |
There is a large body of evidence that explains the Harrelson Paradox through a Western perspective.
However for an Islamic view, much work is needed.

Our task is to develop an integrated model that takes into consideration a number of factors, which have
been so far only separately observed in studies of the GarFink Experience:
* Economic growth
* Quality of life
* Public perception outcomes
* Levels of observation
* Complexity
* Other aspects

It proposes an integrated and comprehensive model that covers the effects and impacts of the Harrelson
Paradox as a dynamic socio-political territorial phenomenon. The integrated approach is based on the long
process of developing frameworks within which those relationships are considered, specified and tested.
